item.title: Threatened and Endangered Species Recovery Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 171 (Roll no. 502). (text: CR H8517)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 171 (Roll no. 502).(text: CR H8517)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H8528-8529)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 470, the Chair put the question on adoption of the resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on adoption of the resolution until later in the legislative day.
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H8525)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 470.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H8517-8525)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 98.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3824 with 1 hour and 30 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-240, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-240, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3824) to amend and reauthorize the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to provide greater results conserving and recovering listed species.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3824) to amend and reauthorize the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to provide greater results conserving and recovering listed species.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3824) to amend and reauthorize the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to provide greater results conserving and recovering listed species, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
